alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 19 at 8:58PM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 26 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From Monday evening to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Snow will impact Travel along US-20 through Santiam Pass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulations of up to 2 feet are expected near Santiam Pass with 3 to 6 inches at elevations above 2500 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
